channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. to commit $2 billion to U.N. humanitarian efforts, as foreign aid cuts continue
item.description: The U.S. will contribute $2 billion to U.N. humanitarian aid in 2026, the State Department said Monday.

item.title: The weakest labor market since 2011 has BofA asking, ‘Dude, where’s my job?’
item.description: "A lack of recovery in the jobs market and a slower U.S. economy are key risks to watch for 2026."

item.title: Gender-Affirming Care Ignores Human Physiology
item.description: Medical elites are redefining health. The human body didn’t get the memo.

item.title: Gen Z could wave goodbye to résumés because most companies have turned to skills-based recruitment—and find it more effective, research shows
item.description: It might not be long until résumé are a thing of the past because most bosses are favoring skills-based hiring and reporting big results.

item.title: New York City finally joins London, Singapore and other world-class cities with a tap-only subway system
item.description: The Metrocard replaced the subway token in 1994, but now it's being phased out for tap-and-go, first introduced in 2019.

item.title: Minneapolis Daycare Scandal Reveals The Trajectory Of Blue Zone Fraud Culture
item.description: Blue Zone political culture is empty. There’s nothing in it. They don’t make anything, they don’t do anything, they aren’t trying to do anything.

item.title: Ben Sasse Reminds Us That Life Is Precious
item.description: The former senator announced last week that he has advanced cancer and does not expect to survive.
